name: Profitability Suite
detailed_description: An advanced multi-dimensional financial hub. TIER 3 transforms it into a predictive command center.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Strategic vision over simple math. This suite teaches the 'Portfolio mindset,' showing how macro-trends and micro-decisions intersect. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Static Sandbox with sample data. TIER_1 (Bronze): Single-property live dashboard. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-property consolidation (up to 5 assets) with historical trend tracking. TIER_3 (Gold): Unlimited Portfolio Command Center with 'Global Risk' scoring and 10-year market cycle simulations. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Financial goals and asset types. Logic: Aggregation of sub-modules. Output: Heat map showing ROI and Equity growth. Coach: 'Diversification' tooltip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Tier 0 locks 'Consolidated View'. RG-02: TIER_2 enables 'Custom Tags' for property grouping. RG-03: TIER_3 allows 'Stress Test' simulations.
column10: Functional Specification: Build a micro-service architecture for a Financial Intelligence Hub. TIER_0: UI-only mockups with hardcoded values. TIER_1 (Starter): Implement a single-unit reactive state for real-time ROI/Cap Rate tracking. TIER_2 (Advanced): Develop a 'Portfolio Aggregator' that merges data from multiple property IDs into a unified view with time-series charts (12-month trailing). TIER_3 (Expert): Architect a 'Simulation Engine' that allows users to adjust global variables (e.g., +2% inflation across the portfolio) and observe the delta in 10-year NPV (Net Present Value). Use public macro-data from central bank APIs for baseline trends.

name: ROI Simulator
detailed_description: A high-precision engine calculating net cash flow with real-time adjustments.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Beginners confuse revenue with profit. This tool focuses on net monthly liquidity. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): 3-field manual simulator. TIER_1 (Bronze): Full expense itemization (fixed charges). TIER_2 (Silver): Sensitivity Analysis (Optimistic/Pessimistic scenarios) and 5-year projection. TIER_3 (Gold): Real-time Ingestion via public bank APIs and national rental indices. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Price, Rent, Loan. Logic: Net Cash-flow = Rent - (Loan + Charges + Reserves). Output: 'Traffic Light' visual. Coach: 10% maintenance provision alert. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_1 required to save simulations. RG-02: TIER_2 required for 'Scenario Comparison' view. RG-03: TIER_3 auto-populates vacancy rates based on public regional stats.
column10: Functional Specification: Implement a high-precision calculation engine (decimal.js). TIER_0: Stateless 3-input UI. TIER_1: Add persistent storage for a detailed expense tree (Condo fees, insurance, etc.). TIER_2: Develop a 'Sensitivity Slider' UI allowing users to see how occupancy changes (e.g., 65% to 85%) impact the break-even date. TIER_3: Build a 'Market Connector' that fetches public data from national statistics offices (e.g., INSEE, ONS) to auto-fill the 'Estimated Vacancy' and 'Market Appreciation' fields based on the property's zip code.

name: Renovation Budget
detailed_description: A strategic Capex tool to prevent budget overruns.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Renovation creep kills profit. Teaches 'Dependency Management' and budgeting. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Generic room-by-room PDF. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive tracker for a single project. TIER_2 (Silver): Quote Comparison Engine (3 quotes per task) and variance tracking. TIER_3 (Gold): AI Quote Auditor comparing against public labor cost indices. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Dimensions + Finish level. Logic: Dynamic total + 15% buffer. Output: Spend-per-room chart. Coach: Focus on 'Hero Amenities'. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_2 required for 'Vendor Management'. RG-02: TIER_3 triggers 'Cost Anomaly' alerts.
column10: Functional Specification: Resource management system. TIER_1: CRUD for renovation tasks with Estimated vs. Actual cost tracking. TIER_2: Implement a 'Quote Matrix'—users input three artisan quotes per task, and the system highlights the median and best value. TIER_3: Integrate a 'Benchmark Engine' that pulls public construction cost indices. If a user enters a painting quote >25% above the public average for that region, trigger a 'Negotiation Required' alert. All data must be linked to FIN_01 to recalculate ROI in real-time.

name: LMNP Tax Simulator
detailed_description: Specialized French tax simulator (Micro-BIC vs. Réel).
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Tax as a yield booster. Teaches the power of depreciation. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Static theory guide. TIER_1 (Bronze): Annual comparison simulator. TIER_2 (Silver): Component-based depreciation (Amortissement par composants) and 5-year tax-loss carryforward. TIER_3 (Gold): 15-year roadmap with 'Regime Switch' alerts. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Price, fees, renos. Logic: Component-based depreciation rules. Output: Cumulative tax savings. Coach: 'Ghost Expense' concept. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: French scope only. RG-02: TIER_2 required for component breakdown. RG-03: TIER_3 predicts the 'Fiscal Pivot' year.
column10: Functional Specification: Logic engine for LMNP (Loueur en Meublé Non Professionnel). TIER_1: Simple two-regime calculation. TIER_2: Implement 'Component Amortization' logic (Structure: 40y, Roof: 15y, Furniture: 7y). TIER_3: Build a 'Fiscal Pivot Optimizer'—the system analyzes the depreciation curve and alerts the user 12 months before they should switch from 'Réel' to 'Micro-BIC' (or vice-versa) to maintain zero taxation. Ensure the logic uses public French tax schedules updated annually via a JSON config file.

name: Section 24 Simulator
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Strategic structural shifts. Teaches the impact of high-rate tax on interest. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Section 24 warning card. TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic tax impact calculator. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-property Section 24 impact across a portfolio. TIER_3 (Gold): Individual vs. Ltd Co Decision Matrix with SDLT/CGT transition simulation. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Global income, mortgage interest. Logic: Net benefit calculation. Output: Incorporation break-even point. Coach: LAYMAN explanation of HMRC rules. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: UK scope only. RG-02: TIER_3 requires full income profile.
column10: Functional Specification: UK Tax Matrix. TIER_1: Calculate the restricted interest relief for a single property. TIER_2: Aggregate multiple property interest costs to show total portfolio tax liability under current Section 24 rules. TIER_3: Build an 'Incorporation Wizard' that simulates moving the portfolio to a Limited Company—calculating Stamp Duty (SDLT), Capital Gains Tax (CGT) 'Incorporation Relief', and ongoing Corporation Tax vs. Dividend Tax. Use public HMRC tax bands for current and future fiscal years.

name: Non-Resident Tax Sim
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Global mindset, local compliance. Teaches 'Double Taxation' protection. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Directory of foreign tax rates. TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic liability estimator for one country. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-country tax summary and Treaty eligibility check. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated form generator (e.g., ES Modelo 210) from financial data. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Residency, Property location, Income. Logic: Apply Bilateral Treaty rules. Output: Quarterly tax due. Coach: 'Withholding Tax' explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Check Treaty DB. RG-02: TIER_3 for form generation.
column10: Functional Specification: Multi-jurisdiction fiscal agent. TIER_1: Calculate tax due in the 'Property Country' based on gross/net income. TIER_2: Implement a 'Treaty Checker' that looks up public OECD/Government bilateral tax treaties to tell the user if they are eligible for a reduced rate. TIER_3: Build a 'Document Mapper'—extract data from the user's financial ledger and map it to specific coordinates on public tax forms (PDF). Use public ECB exchange rates to convert all figures to the local reporting currency.

name: Compliance Checker
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Proactive safety. Teaches zoning laws. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Generic law database. TIER_1 (Bronze): City-level compliance audit. TIER_2 (Silver): Address-specific zoning check and License application tracker. TIER_3 (Gold): 'Sentinel' mode with automated public gazette monitoring and change alerts. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Address. Logic: Geo-spatial check. Output: Legality Score. Coach: Moratoriums tooltip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_3 for push alerts. RG-02: Zone restriction detection.
column10: Functional Specification: Regulatory search engine. TIER_1: Manual city search in an internal DB of public regulations. TIER_2: Address-level lookup using public GIS (Geographic Information System) layers to determine if the property is in a 'Restricted Zone' or 'Saturation Zone'. TIER_3: Build a 'Sentinel Scraper'—asynchronously poll public municipal portals or official council gazettes. If the word 'Tourist', 'STR', or 'License' appears in a new decree for the user's city, trigger a 'High Risk' notification to the user.

name: Regulatory Checklist
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Administrative discipline. Teaches professional operation. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): PDF Checklist. TIER_1 (Bronze): Single-unit interactive tracker. TIER_2 (Silver): Portfolio-wide compliance dashboard with document expiry tracking. TIER_3 (Gold): One-Click Audit Export (ZIP) and automated renewal workflows. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Documents. Logic: Expiry validation. Output: Audit-Ready badge. Coach: Public Liability tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Lock Launch phase if items missing. RG-02: TIER_2 for expiry alerts.
column10: Functional Specification: Document lifecycle manager. TIER_1: Persistent checklist with 4 states (Missing, Pending, Valid, Expired). TIER_2: Develop an 'Expiration Monitor'—users set dates for insurance and safety certs; the system generates a 'Compliance Health Score' across the portfolio. TIER_3: Build an 'Audit Packager'—automatically collect all 'Valid' documents across all properties into a structured and timestamped ZIP file, ready for submission to a municipal inspector in one click.

name: Zweckentfremdungsverbot
detailed_description: Specific analyzer for German 'Misuse Ban' laws.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Navigating bureaucracy. Teaches 'Primary Residence' exceptions. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): German city warning text. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive zone map (Berlin/Munich). TIER_2 (Silver): Permit probability score and local 'Registration Number' tracker. TIER_3 (Gold): Legal Drafting Assistant (Bescheid style) using open-source LLMs. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Address + Intent. Logic: GIS mapping. Output: Permit probability. Coach: 'Primary Residence' exception. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: DE scope only. RG-02: TIER_3 for legal drafts.
column10: Functional Specification: German zoning analyzer. TIER_1: Overlay public municipal GIS data onto a map showing 'Zweckentfremdung' zones. TIER_2: Implement a 'Status Tracker' for the German registration number (Registrierungsnummer)—if the user has a number, the system alerts them of the expiration date according to local city rules. TIER_3: Build a 'Legal Draft Agent' using an open-source LLM (Llama/Mistral)—trained on public German administrative Bescheid examples—to generate a formal permit request letter based on the user's specific case (e.g., temporary absence).

name: Foreign ID Assistant
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Breaking the entry barrier. Teaches administrative sequences. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Required docs list. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive 'Stepper' for one ID type. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-ID tracking and pre-filled letter templates for appointment requests. TIER_3 (Gold): Concierge Bridge with automated status polling for partner files. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Personal PII. Logic: Country delta workflow. Output: Application tracker. Coach: 'What is a NIE?'. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Non-residents only. RG-02: TIER_3 for status polling.
column10: Functional Specification: Onboarding workflow. TIER_1: Guided stepper with 5 milestones (Document Prep, Appointment, Submission, Tax Payment, Collection). TIER_2: Implement a 'Document Generator' that maps user profile data onto public PDF application forms (e.g., EX-15 for Spain). TIER_3: If the user works with a partner concierge, implement a 'Status Bridge'—periodically check a partner-provided webhook or API to update the in-app progress bar so the user knows exactly where their file is (e.g., 'At Tax Office').

name: Essentials List
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Invest in high-impact amenities. Teaches 'ADR Impact' of items. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Static PDF list. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive checklist with basic budget tracking. TIER_2 (Silver): Portfolio-wide inventory standards and room templates. TIER_3 (Gold): Live procurement engine with public price scraping and ROI impact scoring. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Size + Level. Logic: Price-to-Value score. Output: Shopping cart with links. Coach: 'Coffee Rule'. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Sync to FIN_02. RG-02: TIER_3 for price scraping.
column10: Functional Specification: Procurement management. TIER_1: CRUD for item lists with 'Purchased' status. TIER_2: Create 'Standardized Room Templates' (e.g., 'Master Bedroom Silver Standard') that can be cloned across multiple properties. TIER_3: Build a 'Price Scraper' that periodically fetches prices for common items from public retail websites. Use this to flag 'Deals' to the user. Integrate with FIN_01 to show how much each item (e.g., a smart lock) adds to the property's value based on public amenity-value studies.

name: Inventory Generator
detailed_description: Digital inventory for insurance and asset tracking.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Protect your assets. Teaches evidence-based reporting. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Manual text table. TIER_1 (Bronze): Mobile-first photo inventory (10 items max). TIER_2 (Silver): Unlimited inventory with serial number logging and warranty alerts. TIER_3 (Gold): AI Vision Agent identifying items from a single 360° photo. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Photo upload. Logic: Image label detection. Output: Digital Asset Register. Coach: 'Check-in Proof'. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Detect safety equipment. RG-02: TIER_3 for AI detection.
column10: Functional Specification: Asset tracking. TIER_1: Basic image upload and manual tagging. TIER_2: Implement an 'Expiration Engine' for warranties and life-expectancy (e.g., replace mattress in 5y). TIER_3: Integrate an open-source Computer Vision model (like YOLOv8). When a user uploads a room photo, the system must auto-tag visible items (TV, Bed, AC) and check if they match the 'Essentials List' (EXP_01). If an item is missing, flag it as 'Non-Compliant with Standard'.

name: Construction Schedule
detailed_description: A timeline tool for property readiness.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Operations are a sequence. Teaches 'Dependency Management'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Opening countdown. TIER_1 (Bronze): Single-project task list. TIER_2 (Silver): Portfolio-wide timeline and team assignment. TIER_3 (Gold): Self-healing Gantt Engine with dependency logic and delay alerts. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Task list + Relationships. Logic: Critical Path Calculation. Output: Interactive Gantt chart. Coach: 'The Slack Factor'. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Auto-reschedule on delay. RG-02: TIER_3 for Gantt dependency logic.
column10: Functional Specification: Timeline engine. TIER_1: Simple list of tasks with Start/End dates. TIER_2: Implement 'Resource Management'—assign different users (Contractors) to tasks and see their availability across multiple properties. TIER_3: Architect a 'Critical Path Engine'. If a 'Plumbing' task is marked as 'Delayed', the system must automatically shift all 'Blocked' tasks (Painting, Tiling) by the same duration and send an automated notification to the respective contractors via the system.

name: Listing Optimization
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Perception is reality. Teaches CTR optimization. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): 10 'Pro-tips'. TIER_1 (Bronze): Manual audit checklist. TIER_2 (Silver): Competitor amenities gap analysis. TIER_3 (Gold): AI Auditor benchmarking against 'Top 10%' local public listing data. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Listing URL. Logic: Multi-factor scoring. Output: Performance Score (0-100). Coach: 'Hero Photo' tooltip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Min score < 60 warning. RG-02: TIER_3 for competitor scraping.
column10: Functional Specification: Listing auditor. TIER_1: Static rule engine checking for photo count (>15), title length, and amenity presence. TIER_2: Implement an 'Amenities Gap' tool. Compare the user's manual entry against a list of 'Top Demand' amenities for that city (e.g., 'Pool' in Marbella). TIER_3: Build a 'Comp-Set Scraper' using public data (Inside Airbnb). Analyze the top 10% properties in the same zip code and provide a 'Competitive Checklist' of what the user is missing (e.g., 'Competitors have better lighting in bathroom photos').

name: Photo Guide
detailed_description: Pro-level photography guidance with AI enhancement.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Sell the dream. High visuals increase ADR. Teaches framing and lighting. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Framing guides. TIER_1 (Bronze): Mobile camera overlay (Rule of Thirds). TIER_2 (Silver): 'Seasonality Staging' advice and basic filter suite. TIER_3 (Gold): AI Enhancement Engine (HDR/Geometry correction) using open-source models. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Raw photo. Logic: AI HDR + Lens correction. Output: Before/After view. Coach: 'Golden Hour' tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Resolution check. RG-02: TIER_3 for AI enhancement.
column10: Functional Specification: Image processing service. TIER_1: Visual overlays on the mobile capture UI (Grid, Level). TIER_2: Implement a 'Photo Management' system that suggests which photos to use for specific seasons (e.g., 'Highlight the fireplace in winter'). TIER_3: Integrate open-source AI image processing (like OpenCV for vertical alignment or stable-diffusion-based inpainting for decluttering). The system should automatically straighten vertical lines and increase dynamic range (HDR) for indoor shots to make them pop.

name: AI Listing Writer
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Copy that converts. Teaches 'Persona-Based Marketing'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Text templates. TIER_1 (Bronze): 'Mad-libs' style generator. TIER_2 (Silver): Semantic SEO Keyword injection and platform-specific formatting. TIER_3 (Gold): Persona-Based LLM Generator (Luxury/Business/Family) with 10+ languages. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Key features. Logic: Semantic mapping. Output: platform titles. Coach: 'The Hook' tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Multi-language TIER_3. RG-02: Mandatory disclosures.
column10: Functional Specification: Copywriting agent. TIER_1: Simple concatenation engine based on user-selected tags (e.g., 'Near Beach' + 'Quiet'). TIER_2: Implement an 'SEO Keyword Injector'—the system suggests high-volume keywords for the city (from public search data) to be included in the description. TIER_3: Integrate an open-source LLM. Functionally, allow the user to select a 'Target Persona' (e.g., 'Digital Nomad'). The AI then rewrites the description to emphasize WiFi, desk space, and coffee shops, while optimizing the semantic structure for the Airbnb search algorithm.

name: Cerfa Generator
detailed_description: Automated filler for French municipal declarations.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Compliance is vital. Teaches 'Residence Principale' vs 'Secondaire'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Link to portal. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive form generating PDF Cerfa. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-property declaration management and status tracking. TIER_3 (Gold): Digital Admin Proxy with direct portal submission. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Host + Property data. Logic: Mappings to Cerfa 14004*04. Output: Signed PDF. Coach: Registration number explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: France only. RG-02: TIER_3 for portal submission.
column10: Functional Specification: PDF Mapping engine. TIER_1: Map user profile fields to official Cerfa PDF form coordinates. TIER_2: Build a 'Declaration Dashboard'—track which properties have been declared, upload the 'Submission Receipt', and log the issued registration number. TIER_3: For cities with a 'Téléservice', implement a Playwright/Puppeteer script to automate the data entry on the city's official registration portal. The system must capture the generated 'Numéro d'enregistrement' and push it to the MKT dimension.

name: VUT License Assistant
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Due diligence. Teaches Building Statute checks. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Regional guide. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive requirement checklist. TIER_2 (Silver): Province-specific document manager and fee calculator. TIER_3 (Gold): 'Statute Analyzer' with AI-based prohibition detection in PDF docs. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Province + Statutes PDF. Logic: Keyword extraction. Output: Licensability Report. Coach: Moratoriums explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Spain only. RG-02: TIER_3 for statute analysis.
column10: Functional Specification: Legal document analyzer. TIER_1: Conditional requirement tree based on the 17 Spanish regions (CCAA). TIER_2: Implement a 'Fee Calculator'—calculate the exact tax (Tasa) due for the license application based on public regional tables. TIER_3: Build a 'Statute Scanner'—users upload their Building Statutes (Estatutos de la Comunidad). Use an open-source LLM to scan for clauses like 'prohibición de uso turístico'. If found, flag the property as 'High Risk' before the user pays the application fee.

name: Impressum Generator
detailed_description: Generates and hosts German legal notices.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Professional identity. Teaches commercial transparency (§5 TMG). 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Impressum template. TIER_1 (Bronze): Dynamic generator with hosted URL. TIER_2 (Silver): Adaptive Impressum (Multi-host/Company support) and QR Code generator. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated legal update monitoring (EU/TMG updates). 3. User Journey & UI: Input: VAT + Contact data. Logic: Legal text generation. Output: Permalink URL. Coach: Why physical address is required. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Germany only. RG-02: TIER_3 for legal triggers.
column10: Functional Specification: Static site generator + Hosting. TIER_1: Generate a single HTML page with the legally required text and provide a persistent URL. TIER_2: Implement 'QR Code' generation—the user can download a QR code linking to their hosted Impressum to put on their physical property signs. TIER_3: Implement a 'Regulatory Trigger' service—monitor public German legislative feeds. If §5 TMG changes, the system must automatically update the 'Legal Engine' and notify the user that their hosted Impressum has been refreshed to remain compliant.

name: Yield Setup
detailed_description: Initial pricing based on cost-plus and market data.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Pricing as a strategy. Teaches the 'New Listing Boost'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Base price calculator. TIER_1 (Bronze): Seasonal price grid. TIER_2 (Silver): Comp-set benchmarking and 'Price-per-Occupancy' targets. TIER_3 (Gold): Demand-Adaptive Setup with 'Launch Discount' strategy and live neighborhood indices. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Costs + Desired profit. Logic: Cost-plus + Market delta. Output: 12-month calendar. Coach: 15% discount for first 3 reviews. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Min price guardrail. RG-02: TIER_3 for market indices.
column10: Functional Specification: Pricing configurator. TIER_1: Create a 12-month grid with two states: 'Standard' and 'High Season'. TIER_2: Implement 'Occupancy-Based Rules'—if the user's manual calendar is >80% full for next month, suggest a 10% price increase. TIER_3: Integrate with public neighborhood data (e.g., Inside Airbnb). Calculate a 'Market Percentile' for the user's property. If they are in the 20th percentile (cheapest), suggest a ramp-up strategy to reach the 50th percentile as their review count grows.

name: iCal Sync
detailed_description: Basic calendar sync to prevent double bookings.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Trust is built on reliability. Teaches foundations of distribution. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): 1-way export. TIER_1 (Bronze): 2-way sync (1-hour refresh). TIER_2 (Silver): High-Frequency Sync (15m) and conflict resolution UI. TIER_3 (Gold): Near-real-time Sync (5m) with automated collision-detection and Push alerts. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: iCal URLs. Logic: Chronological merge. Output: Unified calendar. Coach: API vs iCal tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Sync failure alert. RG-02: TIER_3 for high frequency.
column10: Functional Specification: Calendar sync service. TIER_1: Cron job every 60 minutes to pull and push .ics files. TIER_2: Implement a 'Collision UI'—if an iCal import overlaps with an existing booking, highlight the conflict in red and prompt the user for a manual override. TIER_3: Optimize the sync frequency to 5 minutes. Implement 'Intelligent Polling'—if a 'Booking Request' email is detected in the connected inbox (optional), trigger an immediate out-of-band sync for that property to block dates before the iCal refresh.

name: Channel Manager
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Scale through automation. Teaches 'Single Source of Truth'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): iCal Basic. TIER_1 (Bronze): API Connection for 1 platform. TIER_2 (Silver): API Connection for 3 platforms + Basic content/photo sync. TIER_3 (Gold): Unlimited API Distribution with advanced pricing rules and Instant Sync. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: API Keys. Logic: Direct API push/pull. Output: Sync Status Dashboard. Coach: Why API > iCal. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_2 for multi-channel. RG-02: 'Global Markup' logic.
column10: Functional Specification: Distribution engine. TIER_1: Implement OAuth flows for a single OTA (e.g., Airbnb). TIER_2: Support up to 3 OTAs and implement 'Price Markups'—the user sets a base price, and the system adds X% for Booking.com and Y% for Vrbo to cover their respective commissions. TIER_3: Enable 'Content Sync'—functionally allow the user to manage photos and descriptions once in the SaaS and push them to all API-connected channels. Implement 'Atomic Updates' to prevent overbooking across 50+ channels.

name: Airbnb Connector
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Channel-specific mastery. Teaches first-response ranking. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Availability sync. TIER_2 (Silver): Guest Messaging and automated 'Saved Replies'. TIER_3 (Gold): Full Content Parity and AI-automated review response. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Airbnb login. Logic: Content mapping. Output: Sync status. Coach: Response time importance. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: 90-day re-auth. RG-02: TIER_2 for messaging.
column10: Functional Specification: Airbnb API integration. TIER_1: Basic availability and price push. TIER_2: Integrate the 'Messaging API'—build a 'Unified Inbox' where the host can reply to Airbnb threads. Implement 'Triggers'—e.g., automatically send the 'Check-in Instructions' message 24h before arrival. TIER_3: Enable 'Full Content Management'—users can edit 'House Rules' and 'Check-out instructions' in the SaaS and sync them to Airbnb. Use an open-source LLM to suggest responses to guest reviews based on the guest's rating.

name: Booking.com Connector
detailed_description: Advanced XML connection for professional management.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Professional rigor. Teaches 'Rate Plans' and payment security. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Availability sync. TIER_2 (Silver): Management of 'Flexible' vs 'Non-refundable' rates. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated Promotion management and VCC processing. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Booking ID. Logic: Rate Plan mapping. Output: Policy dashboard. Coach: Non-refundable rates tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_3 for VCC capture.
column10: Functional Specification: Booking.com XML integration. TIER_1: Push availability and base rate. TIER_2: Implement 'Rate Plan Overrides'—allow the user to set a specific price for 'Non-Refundable' bookings that differs from the 'Flexible' rate. TIER_3: Build a 'Promotion Engine'—the user can launch 'Black Friday' or 'Last Minute' deals directly from the SaaS. Implement 'Virtual Credit Card' (VCC) handling—functionally capture the card data and process it through a connected Stripe account automatically on the day the VCC becomes active.

name: Vrbo Connector
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Niche targeting. Teaches content adaptation for families. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic sync. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-unit grouping and family-amenity optimization. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated cross-platform content sync and guest vetting logic. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Vrbo account. Logic: Content optimization. Output: Listing health check. Coach: Kitchen photos tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Age limit sync.
column10: Functional Specification: Vrbo API integration. TIER_1: Push availability. TIER_2: Implement 'Family Filter Optimization'—the system scans the property amenities and automatically highlights 'Crib', 'High Chair', and 'Safety Gates' for the Vrbo listing to improve ranking in family searches. TIER_3: Enable 'Cross-Channel Content Bridge'—if a user updates the 'Property Description' for Airbnb, the system suggests a 'Vrbo-optimized' version that focuses more on family activities and house-safety, ready to be pushed to Vrbo with one click.

name: Police Connection
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Legal peace of mind. Teaches 'Identity Management'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Police portal links. TIER_1 (Bronze): Manual CSV Export. TIER_2 (Silver): Automated 'Due Soon' reminders and in-app ID collection portal. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated API Submission with mobile OCR scanning. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Guest ID scan. Logic: XML formatting. Output: Submission receipt. Coach: 24-hour rule explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Non-reporting alert. RG-02: TIER_3 for mobile scan.
column10: Functional Specification: Compliance reporting. TIER_1: Generate a CSV file matching the police portal's 'Bulk Upload' format. TIER_2: Build a 'Guest Pre-check-in' page—a link sent to guests where they upload a photo of their ID. The system validates that all required fields (Name, Passport No, DOB) are present. TIER_3: Implement the 'Police API Bridge'—automatically push the collected guest data to the authorities' API (e.g., SES.HOSPEDERIAS for Spain) exactly at the time of check-in. Store the API 'Success' response as legal proof.

name: 90-Day Counter
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Respect local limits. Teaches 'Short vs Mid-term' balance. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Manual night counter. TIER_1 (Bronze): Automated counter from connected calendars. TIER_2 (Silver): 'Remaining Capacity' forecasting and 'Switch to 30+' strategy alerts. TIER_3 (Gold): Smart Cap with automated multi-channel calendar blocking. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Booking data. Logic: Nights calculation. Output: Progress bar. Coach: 30+ day strategy tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: London scope only. RG-02: TIER_3 for auto-blocking.
column10: Functional Specification: Night counter logic. TIER_1: Sum all (Checkout - Check-in) for bookings within the current calendar year. TIER_2: Develop a 'Forecasting Tool'—based on the current pace, predict which month the 90-day limit will be hit. If the limit is reached, trigger an alert suggesting the user update their 'Minimum Stay' to 30 nights in MKT settings to bypass the limit. TIER_3: Implement a 'Safety Switch'—the moment the 91st night is booked, the system must push a 'Closed' availability status to all OTA APIs for the rest of the year.

name: Task Automation
dev_prompt:
1. Pedagogical Objective: Efficiency through events. Teaches 'Workflow Automation'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Manual tasks. TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic triggers (e.g., 'Clean after Checkout'). TIER_2 (Silver): Complex logic (e.g., 'If guest < 2 nights, skip full laundry') and provider assignment. TIER_3 (Gold): Intelligent Engine with Smart Lock integration and dynamic rescheduling. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Rules. Logic: If 

$$Event$$

 -> Action. Output: Automation log. Coach: Early Checkout tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Sync with OPS_09. RG-02: TIER_3 for lock events.
column10: Functional Specification: Rules engine. TIER_1: Simple trigger system—Event: 'Booking Created' -> Action: 'Create Cleaning Task' on Checkout Date. TIER_2: Implement 'Conditional Tasks'—e.g., 'If stay > 7 days, create Mid-stay Clean on Day 4'. Assign tasks automatically to specific users based on the property. TIER_3: Integrate with Smart Lock APIs (Nuki, Yale). Functionally, if the guest locks the door from the outside and 'Check-out' is expected today, trigger the 'Clean Now' notification to the provider immediately, regardless of the scheduled checkout time.

name: Provider App
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Remote quality control. Teaches 'Evidence-Based Reporting'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Email notification. TIER_1 (Bronze): WebApp with basic task list. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-provider access and detailed 'Room-by-Room' checklists. TIER_3 (Gold): Field Terminal with mandatory 'Photo Proof' and instant Inventory alerts. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Tap to start. Logic: Geofenced check-in. Output: Cleanliness Certificate. Coach: 'After' photos tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Min 3 photos. RG-02: TIER_3 for low-stock button.
column10: Functional Specification: Mobile PWA. TIER_1: Basic view showing Task Name, Address, and a 'Complete' button. TIER_2: Implement 'Step-by-Step Checklists'—the cleaner must check off each sub-task (e.g., 'Empty Trash', 'Fresh Linens') before completing the mission. TIER_3: Build a 'Photo Validation' module—the 'Complete' button is disabled until the cleaner uploads at least one photo per room. Implement a 'Refill Request' button—if the cleaner taps it, it automatically creates a 'Restock' task and adds the items to the shopping list in EXP_01.

name: Ticketing System
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Close the loop on breakage. Teaches 'Asset Maintenance'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic incident list. TIER_2 (Silver): Assigned tickets with priority levels and cost tracking. TIER_3 (Gold): Damage-to-Claim bridge and automated security deposit claim generation. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Report issue. Logic: Priority assignment. Output: Incident history. Coach: Wear and Tear vs Damage. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Link photos to OPS_09. RG-02: TIER_3 for claim generation.
column10: Functional Specification: Issue tracker. TIER_1: Simple CRUD for maintenance tickets. TIER_2: Implement 'Financial Tracking' per ticket—user inputs 'Cost of Repair' and 'Labor Hours'. This data must flow into FIN_00 as a variable expense. TIER_3: Build a 'Resolution Bridge'—if a cleaner reports damage (OPS_09), the system creates a ticket. Functionally, allow the user to click 'Claim Deposit'—the system generates a PDF containing the 'Before' photo (from EXP_02), the 'Damage' photo, and the 'Replacement Cost' (from EXP_01), ready for platform dispute resolution.

name: Commission Splitter
detailed_description: Automated revenue sharing for property managers.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Financial transparency. Teaches 'Net-to-Owner' clarity. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Manual % calculator per booking. TIER_2 (Silver): Automated monthly reconciliation for up to 3 owners. TIER_3 (Gold): Automated Distribution with Stripe Connect payouts and Whitelabel Reports. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Commission %. Logic: Gross - Fees - Expenses = Net. Output: Statement of Account. Coach: Expense Proofs tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: TIER_2 for multi-owner. RG-02: TIER_3 for auto-payouts.
column10: Functional Specification: Reconciliation engine. TIER_1: Simple calculator—User inputs 'Gross Rent', system outputs 'Commission (15%)' and 'Owner Share'. TIER_2: Implement 'Expense Deductions'—allow the host to tag specific maintenance tickets (OPS_10) or cleaning tasks (OPS_08) as 'Owner Charged'. The system subtracts these from the monthly payout. TIER_3: Integrate with Stripe Connect—automatically split the incoming booking payment (if SaaS is the merchant) or trigger an ACH/SEPA payout of the 'Net Share' to the owner's bank account on the 1st of every month.

name: Mandate Generator
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Secure delegation. Teaches legal boundaries. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Downloadable templates. TIER_2 (Silver): Variable-based generator for custom fee structures. TIER_3 (Gold): Mandate Generator with e-Signature integration and 'Legal Vault' storage. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Fees + Liability. Logic: Variable text generation. Output: Digital contract. Coach: Liability explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Termination clause mandatory. RG-02: TIER_3 for e-signature.
column10: Functional Specification: Legal document generator. TIER_1: Provide a library of Word/PDF templates based on the property's country. TIER_2: Implement 'Dynamic Clause Injection'—based on the user's fee setup (FIN_08), the system builds a custom management contract by inserting specific text snippets into the legal template. TIER_3: Integrate an e-signature API (e.g., HelloSign, DocuSign). Functionally, once the contract is generated, the host can send it to the owner for signing. The final signed document is stored with a blockchain-based timestamp (hash) for tamper-proof verification.

name: Web Welcome Book
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Automate the obvious. Teaches 'Front-loading' information. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_0 (Beginner): Text-only rules. TIER_1 (Bronze): Interactive Guide for 1 property. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-property guides with shared 'Local Tips' and neighborhood maps. TIER_3 (Gold): Experience Portal with 'Upsell Store' and AI auto-translation. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: WiFi, Rules, Tips. Logic: Status-aware content. Output: PWA / QR Code. Coach: The first 5 mins tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: QR Code generation. RG-02: TIER_3 for Stripe upsells.
column10: Functional Specification: Guest-facing PWA. TIER_1: Responsive web page showing text and images for WiFi, Parking, and House Rules. TIER_2: Implement 'Global Content Blocks'—allow the host to create a list of 'Recommended Restaurants' once and assign it to multiple properties in the same city. TIER_3: Build an 'Upsell Checkout'—the host can list 'Extras' (e.g., 'Late Checkout: 20€', 'Welcome Wine: 15€'). Guests can purchase these via Apple/Google Pay. All sales are pushed to the 'Commission Splitter' (FIN_08) as guest-paid extras.

name: Guest AI Chatbot
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: 24/7 responsiveness. Teaches 'Knowledge Base' management. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Automated SMS triggers. TIER_2 (Silver): Rule-based FAQ triggers and 'Human Handover' UI. TIER_3 (Gold): Contextual AI Assistant using RAG on property-specific PDF manuals and guides. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Chat. Logic: Search within manuals. Output: Conversational answer. Coach: Speed of Response tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Escalation if confidence < 80%. RG-02: 20+ languages.
column10: Functional Specification: Conversational AI. TIER_1: Simple keyword-based auto-replies (e.g., if message contains 'WiFi', send WiFi code). TIER_2: Implement a 'Host Dashboard' for chat—if the bot can't answer, it pings the host and allows them to take over the conversation seamlessly. TIER_3: Implement 'Retrieval-Augmented Generation' (RAG)—the AI 'reads' the Welcome Book (EXP_03) and the user-uploaded appliance manuals (PDF). If a guest asks 'How do I use the coffee machine?', the AI provides the exact steps from the manual. Use an open-source model (e.g., Mistral-7B) to maintain data privacy.

name: Occupancy Stats
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Don't celebrate in a vacuum. Teaches RevPAR. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Personal occupancy charts. TIER_2 (Silver): Comparative year-on-year stats and 'Loss of Opportunity' analysis. TIER_3 (Gold): Predictive Benchmarking against local Comp-set open data. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Booking data. Logic: RevPAR = ADR x Occ%. Output: Market comparison graph. Coach: The RevPAR Myth. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Confirmed bookings only. RG-02: TIER_3 for comp-set.
column10: Functional Specification: Analytics engine. TIER_1: Simple time-series chart showing 'Occupancy Rate' and 'ADR' over the last 12 months. TIER_2: Implement 'Year-over-Year' (YoY) comparison—show how this month compares to the same month last year. Functionally, calculate 'Unearned Revenue'—how much money was lost due to empty nights that could have been filled at a lower price. TIER_3: Pull public data from Inside Airbnb for the city. Functionally, show the user's RevPAR vs. the average RevPAR for 'Similar Properties' (same bedroom count/city) to provide a true performance index.

name: FEC Export
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Accounting as a habit. Teaches 'Digital Record Keeping'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Annual CSV export. TIER_2 (Silver): Quarterly shadow ledger and VAT pre-calculation. TIER_3 (Gold): Standardized FEC Exporter with direct accounting software sync. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Receipts + Income. Logic: Double-entry bridge. Output: .txt FEC file. Coach: Why FEC is mandatory. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: France only. RG-02: Zero balance required.
column10: Functional Specification: Fiscal logging system. TIER_1: Generate a simple flat file with all transactions categorized. TIER_2: Implement a 'Pre-Accounting Ledger'—ensure every transaction has a Debit and Credit entry according to the French Plan Comptable. Functionally, allow the user to 'Tag' receipts from their phone. TIER_3: Build the 'FEC Generator'—ensure the output file exactly matches the 18-field structure required by French law. Implement a 'Digital Link' that push-notifies the host's accountant when the quarterly data is ready for export.

name: MTD Export
detailed_description: UK HMRC 'Making Tax Digital' (MTD) compliant data exporter.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Compliance through digital links. Teaches 'Audit Trail'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Formatted spreadsheet export. TIER_2 (Silver): Quarterly tax liability tracker and 'Digital Link' verification. TIER_3 (Gold): MTD Compliance Bridge with direct submission to HMRC API. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Ledger data. Logic: Quarterly calculation. Output: HMRC receipt. Coach: Copy-pasting risk tip. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: UK only. RG-02: TIER_3 for API submission.
column10: Functional Specification: HMRC API bridge. TIER_1: Export data in the exact format required for the MTD-compliant Excel templates. TIER_2: Build a 'Tax Liability Forecast'—based on the current quarter's profit, calculate the estimated tax due to HMRC so the user can set aside the cash. TIER_3: Implement the 'MTD Submission' workflow—functionally connect to the HMRC Government Gateway via OAuth and submit the quarterly 'Updates' directly from the SaaS without any manual data entry.

name: Double Tax Report
detailed_description: Report for declaring foreign income avoiding double taxation.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Global profit, home protection. Teaches Double Taxation Treaties. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Income summary per country. TIER_2 (Silver): Detailed Foreign Tax Credit (FTC) calculation for the home country return. TIER_3 (Gold): Tax Treaty Advisor with 'Filing Map' using public OECD/Treaty data. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Residency + Property locations. Logic: Apply OECD rules. Output: Filing Guide. Coach: Treaty explanation. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Flag if no treaty. RG-02: TIER_2 for FTC calculation.
column10: Functional Specification: Cross-border tax logic. TIER_1: Aggregate total income and local taxes paid in the 'Property Country'. TIER_2: Implement the 'Tax Credit Formula' for the home country (e.g., in France, the 'crédit d'impôt égal à l'impôt français'). Functionally, tell the user exactly what to report on their 'Home' return. TIER_3: Build a 'Filing Guide'—using public OECD data, generate a PDF explaining the specific Treaty Article that applies. Functionally, show screenshots of the host's national tax portal with fléches (arrows) indicating where to copy-paste the SaaS-calculated figures.

name: RevPAR Optimizer
detailed_description: Automated pricing algorithm maximizing total revenue.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Pricing as a living strategy. Teaches 'Demand Elasticity'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Rule-based pricing (e.g., 'Last minute discount'). TIER_2 (Silver): Event-based pricing (Public holidays/School holidays) and 1x daily sync. TIER_3 (Gold): AI Dynamic Pricing with 20+ public variables (Weather, Events) and 4x daily updates. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Min/Max Price. Logic: Demand Elasticity Modeling. Output: Price Forecast. Coach: Empty night vs cheap sell. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Unlimited sync TIER_3. RG-02: Never below 'Min Price'.
column10: Functional Specification: Dynamic pricing engine. TIER_1: Simple 'Rules Engine'—e.g., 'If date < 2 days away, discount 20%'. TIER_2: Implement 'Public Calendar Integration'—automatically increase prices by 30% for all national holidays and local school holiday dates (from public school calendar APIs). TIER_3: Architect an 'Elasticity Model'—fetch public data for local events (concerts, festivals) and weather. Functionally, if a major concert is detected and availability is low in the city, the system must aggressively raise prices on those specific dates across all API channels.

name: Direct Booking Site
detailed_description: Commission-free website builder for direct bookings.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Take back control. Teaches 'Direct Traffic' value. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Single property landing page with inquiry form. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-property booking site with real-time calendar and 'Returning Guest' discounts. TIER_3 (Gold): High-Performance Engine with Loyalty module, Referral tracking, and Whitelabel checkout. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Logo + Domain. Logic: Real-time availability pull. Output: Hosted site. Coach: The Billboard Effect. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Stripe required. RG-02: Auto SSL.
column10: Functional Specification: Booking SPA (Single Page Application). TIER_1: A static-ish page with a 'Contact Host' button that prefills the booking dates. TIER_2: Implement 'Live Inventory Connection'—guests can select dates and see the final price (including cleaning fees) before clicking 'Request to Book'. Implement a 'Coupon Engine' for the host. TIER_3: Build a 'One-Click Checkout'—guests pay via Stripe directly on the site. Functionally, implement a 'Loyalty Tracker'—if a guest's email matches a previous booking in the system, automatically apply a 'Returning Guest' discount.

name: Team Management
detailed_description: Multi-user access control for delegating operations.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Delegation without risk. Teaches process isolation. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): 1 Co-host (Full access). TIER_2 (Silver): Preset roles (Cleaner, Accountant, Co-host) with restricted views. TIER_3 (Gold): Granular RBAC Portal with feature-level permissions and Security Audit Logging. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Team email. Logic: Permission masking. Output: Activity log. Coach: Password sharing warning. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Owner cannot be deleted. RG-02: TIER_3 for custom roles.
column10: Functional Specification: RBAC (Role-Based Access Control). TIER_1: Allow one additional user with full view access but no 'Settings' access. TIER_2: Implement 'Role Presets'—e.g., the 'Cleaner' role can only see the OPS dimension; the 'Accountant' can only see the FIN dimension and exports. TIER_3: Build a 'Permission Matrix'—the owner can create a custom role 'Weekend Support' and toggle access for every single feature ID (e.g., allow Guest Messaging but block Revenue Stats). Log every 'Write' action with the user ID and timestamp for a 'Security Audit' view.

name: Investor Portal
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Professionalism as a service. Teaches transparency. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Monthly PDF reports. TIER_2 (Silver): Read-Only dashboard for 1 owner with live revenue stats. TIER_3 (Gold): Whitelabel Investor Portal with custom ROI commentary and portfolio performance narratives. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Manager commentary. Logic: Operational noise filtering. Output: Investor view. Coach: Context over numbers. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Read-only enforced. RG-02: Manager review mandatory.
column10: Functional Specification: Shared dashboard. TIER_1: Automate the generation of the monthly FIN_08 report and send it to the owner's email. TIER_2: Provide a 'Login Link' for the owner—functionally, they see a simplified version of FIN_05 and FIN_08, filtered only for their property. TIER_3: Enable 'White-labeling'—the manager can upload their own logo for the investor's view. Functionally, implement a 'Narrative Module'—the manager writes a short 'Monthly Performance Summary' that appears at the top of the owner's dashboard.

name: Company Audit
detailed_description: Simulation for transitioning to corporate ownership.
dev_prompt: 1. Pedagogical Objective: Long-term legacy. Teaches 'Succession' and 'Exit taxes'. 2. Behavior Matrix: TIER_1 (Bronze): Basic IR vs IS calculator. TIER_2 (Silver): Multi-year wealth projection (10 years) including maintenance Capex. TIER_3 (Gold): Structural Wealth Optimization with 20-year exit strategy and Inheritance tax planning. 3. User Journey & UI: Input: Portfolio value. Logic: Wealth Impact simulation. Output: Transition Roadmap. Coach: 'The Trap' warning. 4. Business Logic: RG-01: Country-specific tax rules. RG-02: Legal disclaimer mandatory.
column10: Functional Specification: Wealth simulator. TIER_1: Simple comparison of the tax paid this year if the income was personal vs. corporate. TIER_2: Implement a '10-year Equity Projection'—calculate how much mortgage principal is paid down and how that equity grows under different structures. TIER_3: Build a 'Succession Simulator'—using public national inheritance tax tables, show the delta in tax liability for the host's heirs if the properties are held in a 'Family Holding' vs. personally. Output a 'Structural Roadmap' with a checklist of legal steps to incorporate.
